intro: Bonamia tsivory, commonly known as the Madagascar bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
